page.title: 18CHAPEL FARM
page.content: Chapel Farm is ojne of the nearest farms to the school and is located on the road to Shraleybrook.The farmhouse was built in 1701 and it gets its name from the Methodist Chapel that used to be next door but which is now used as a barn to store hay.The present owners have lived there for 23 years but have no children to carry on the work on the farm. All the 50 acres are used for grass and there are 36 milking cows and 19 young ones.The farm is the smallest in the area and is the only one which was not on land owned by Sir Thomas Boughey who donated the land on which our school was built in 1849. Chapel farm still has to employ a farm hand and the help of a local vet about once every 3 months to help the sick animals. ClassB3
